name: Mantra Lorne

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This resort is ideally placed between the beach and boutique shops on the main road of Lorne. We spent two nights in the heritage building in a good size bedroom and a lovely spacious bathroom. The hotel interior has been beautifully maintained and the walls of the hotel foyer has wonderful old photos telling stories of tourists and holiday makers in the early 1900's. The resort as it stands today is heaps bigger and different to the original building and the manicured gardens and lawn area is excellent for children to play. Breakfasts were fantastic, as was our dinner. But the best part was the friendly service we received from staff who made us feel welcomed.
reviews.title: Great getaway!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We just spent a fantastic weekend at Mantra Lorne. The grounds of this property are simply beautiful. Plenty of activities for singles, couples and families. We had a room in the heritage building and loved it. The room was spacious, great bathroom and a lovely balcony with water view. The breakfast was great, lots to choose from. Front desk staff were all lovely. Heath checked us in, he was efficient, informative and very professional. Great stay and excited to go back!
reviews.title: Surprised!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had a few nights at the Mantra Lorne and stayed in a 1 Bedroom Apartment. Great ocean views and their gardens which are impeccable. It was fantastic to watch many adults and children enjoying themselves on the property. The only downside was the bedroom curtains where a bit hard to keep properly closed and the electric stove left a lot to be desired! Overall, the apartment and its facilities, the property, the balcony, the service and the views were all terrific. We are very much looking to getting back there.
reviews.title: Great spot

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here for 2 nights as part of our Great Ocean Road trip and I was initially hesitant about booking here due to other negative reviews. However, a special on their Heritage Rooms was too good to refuse so we took a chance, and I'm glad we did.
reviews.title: Great Location and Resort

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The checkin staff were extremely friendly and helpful, the room was a good size, well maintained and clean, with all the amenities you'd expect. The included breakfast was excellent, and sitting out on the deck in the morning was amazing. Again, the staff at breakfast were friendly. The location is ideal and is the only hotel on the beach side of the road that we could see. It's a 2 minute walk to the main street for restaurants. I would definitely consider this again for a future trip.
reviews.title: Pity it was Easter

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012
reviews.text: Rooms were comfortable. Loved the sporting options - pool, lawn bowls close, tennis etc. local shops close. Most enjoyable short break... Friendly staff as well...My wife loved the day spa component. Pub close by was handy as well as bakery and coffee shops. Will be naval for sure..
reviews.title: Loved This Place

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled on business
reviews.text: Intercept (Victoria) had our annual conference at Mantra Lorne and everyone to a person raved about the property. They looked after all our conference needs, fed us very well and the rooms were modern, clean and comfortable. We will be back again for more.
reviews.title: A great Conference Experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We have stayed here for couple of nights over the weekend in the Heritage Room. Rooms are a bit dated but generous in size. We didn't like the fact that the bathroom sink was actually in the bedroom but we got used to it by the time we left. Bathroom is very small and there is very little space between the toilet and a shower so I think this could be a bit of a problem for an overweight person. There is no heating in the bathroom so it was quite cold for a shower, even more so if you've turned on the light which was connected to bathroom fan - brrrrr!! Not very pleasant in winter months.Also the bathroom needed a good dusting!
reviews.title: Quiet, pleasant stay...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Room itself was clean and comfortable and so was the bed. Enough coffee/tea provided.
reviews.title: Didn't have to stay there

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: buffet breakfast was great, good selection of cold and hot food, and at $20 per person very good value.
reviews.title: Eggceptional Easter Escape

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had an ocean view resort room and had great views of the ocean albeit across the tennis courts in-between our 2nd floor room and the ocean. We spent two nights there and location is just awesome. Very quiet (although we were there in Winter so not sure how busy and noisy it'll be in Summer months. We walked to the restaurants and pub each night (5 mins easy walk). Breakfast at the bakery across the road for brekkie was nice too. Service was cheerful and helpful. Having the heated pool/sauna was fantastic and all the other amenities which we didn't use but saw looked fantastic. The room itself was well presented and clean. Bed was very comfy indeed and the balcony/breakfast nook was well designed. Only gripe would be that the fan in the bathroom didn't suck up enough moisture leaving the mirrors all fogged up.
reviews.title: Perfect location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled with family
reviews.text: I was on holiday in Melbourne over easter 2013, and for a nice break by the sea, we booked a two bedroom unit at Mantra Lorne. Have a look at the website, and you will see photos of the resort. They are all along similar lines- airy, modern apartments looking out over the sea or tranquil views over trees and lawns. What could go wrong? Plenty.
reviews.title: Let's be honest about what's on offer

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The apartment we had gave us the choice of a view of the industrial bins at the back of the function centre, with the attendant noise of bottle being disposed of at all hours, or directly into the living room of an apartment in the next block. To avoid a view of the people in the next apartment we had to keep the blinds drawn- so much for light and airy!
reviews.title: Great location and facilities

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled with family
reviews.text: Whoever designed this resort was trying to get the maximum return on the space available without any consideration of the amenity for the people paying good money to stay there.
reviews.title: Beautiful resort

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My point is that what really upsets people is when there is a vast gulf between the expectation generated by the website and the reality when they arrive at the resort. Please do look at the photos I have uploaded and compare them to the advertising from Mantra- you wouldn't believe it was the same place.
reviews.title: Tired, rundown and needs attention

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed in one of the apartments overlooking the ocean. The room was clean and tidy with good amenities. As the room overlooked the beach it was very quiet at night, with only the sound of the waves rolling in. The facilities in the hotel were OK, the gym was small but functional and the pool area/sauna/steam room looked good. The breakfast buffet was a different matter. It seems that most guests arrive at the same time (9am) after which the staff are completely overwhelmed. Difficult to get a seat and you may have to clear your own table. The range of food was as expected for a buffet of this kind, however the kitchen could not keep up with the demand for the hot food leading to long queues and rapid emptying was the food arrives. Overall, quite an expensive hotel for what you get but not surprising given the lack of competition in Lorne.
reviews.title: Great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My fiancé recently stayed at the Mantra Lorne for the second time. We love it. The location is fantastic. We walked straight from the resort to Erskine Falls and back. The restaurant is a good price and overlooks the beach. They indoor pool is great and was relaxing swimming after our day walk. We shall be back!
reviews.title: Great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013
reviews.text: We stayed in a large and nicely furnished room and couldn't complain about the facilities, albeit the view of the industrial bins from the balcony. The only real disappointment of our stays was the buffet breakfast which left a sour taste in our mouth as we left that morning. The buffet was extremely busy, which is understandable but there were only a handful of staff managing the buffet and most of the time guests were standing around the buffet waiting for food to be brought out, and the rest of the staff were swanning around slowly cleaning up tables oblivious to the fact that most guests were unhappily waiting for food. You will enjoy a pleasant stay, but avoid dining at the resort and instead enjoy the proximity of the resort to many wonderful eating spots in Lorne.
reviews.title: Nice rooms but avoid the breakfast

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: On arrival had high hopes, then we got to our complex and that is when illusion was lost, room was even more uninviting.... cold in temp and in appearance, no toilet paper and same piece of litter was on the stair well for our entire stay. Not to mention room service finished at 8.30pm, which is when we arrived on a Friday night.... there is no mention of that when you book and say you will be getting there around 9.
reviews.title: Very disapointing - overpriced & over ranked

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled with friends
reviews.text: We had booked an Ocean View One Bedroom apartment, and paid handsomly for it (better value for money in the local pub for same view)
reviews.title: not-so-happy hour

description: The only beachfront property in Lorne, Mantra Lorne offers wonderful accommodation in one of Australia’s most sought after destinations, the Great Ocean Road. Built around the oldest guesthouse in Victoria, Mantra Lorne is now a part of the rich history of Lorne and the surrounding region. With the beachfront location and the 12 acres of beautifully landscaped gardens that surround the resort, Mantra Lorne is the ideal setting for weddings and boasts the title of largest residential conference destination in Victoria. Providing numerous guest facilities, as well as being in an area full of off-site adventures, Mantra Lorne caters to the needs of everyone, making it the perfect holiday destination for families, friends, couples or business people. Relax by the indoor pool, have a hit of tennis or explore the Great Ocean Road for which Lorne is famed for. Offering resort, hotel, one and two bedroom apartments, an onsite restaurant and endota Day Spa you’re sure to be pleased, whatever your intended stay.
